title: User can Save a Roster
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is viewing the Roster Management Utility
AND the "Save" Button is visible
AND the button should be a split button that allows the user to choose whether to save "Roster(s) & Comments" or "Comments Only"
custom_steps: WHEN When the user clicks Save
custom_expected:
THEN if "Roster(s) & Comments" is selected, the system will capture a snapshot of the roster information for the selected Org, Level and Club as applicable, and write the information to the appropriate table based on the "Save Roster As" selection.
AND a successful blue notification will display. "{Roster type} Roster has been saved successfully" 
BUT if "Comments Only" then only the comments will be saved

title: User can Access Roster Management
custom_preconds: GIVEN "Rosters" is an option on the left nav menu.
custom_steps:
WHEN Clicking on Rosters, user then clicks Special Rosters.
OR
When hovering over Rosters, user then clicks Special Rosters.
custom_expected: THEN it will open to the Roster's "Roster Management" tab

title: A user can Save Comments for a Roster
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user  viewing the Roster Management Utility, there is a Comments section that is always editable.
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks Save and selects "Roster(s) & Comments"
custom_expected:
THEN  the system will capture the entered comments at the same time as the snapshot of the roster information for the selected Org, Level and Club as applicable, and write the information to the appropriate table based on the "Save Roster As" selection. 
BUT when the user clicks Save and selects "Comments Only", 
THEN the system will capture the entered comments but will NOT take a new snapshot of the roster information for the selected Org, Level and Club as applicable, and write the information to the appropriate table based on the "Save Roster As" selection. 
AND A successful blue notification will display. "{Roster type} Roster comments have been saved successfully" only when "Comments Only" is selected for Save.

title: A user will receive an error when attempting to Save Comments for a Roster that has not been saved yet
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on a Roster
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks Save and selects "Comments Only"
custom_expected:
THEN the system will check that a roster has already been saved for the associated year, Org, Level and Club filters selected
AND If one has not yet been saved, then an error message will be displayed "The selected special roster does not exist."

title: Receive error attempting to Save Comments for Roster that has NOT been saved yet
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is saving a Roster for the first time
AND selects an associated year, Org, level, and club filter
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks Save
AND selects "Comments Only"
custom_expected: THEN user receives message; "The selected roster does not exist."

title: A user can see a player's Eligible Recall Date in the MJ Roster widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN  "Eligible Recall Date" is a column in the Major League Roster widget
custom_steps: WHEN player's current MJ Roster Status is "Optioned"
custom_expected:
THEN display the date
AND IF the Assignment Date on the "Optional Assignment" is after System Date Spring Training Start but before System Date First day of Major Lg. Season
Then the Eligible Recall Date is 10 days from System Date First day of Major Lg. Season (Opening Day date + 10 days)
AND if the Assignment Date on the "Optional Assignment" is on or after System Date First day of Major Lg. Season
THEN the Eligible Recall Date is 10 days from the "Assignment Date on his Optional Assignment (option date + 10 days)
BUT in the above scenario, if the "Post Game Assignment" checkbox was checked in the Optional Assignment
Then the Eligible Recall Date is 11 days from the day after the option date (option date + 11 days)

title: Club user can see the Roster Counts widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN club user is on HOME page
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Roster Widget
custom_expected:
THEN The widget will default to the Org of the logged in user.
AND will provide the current active and under control limits for each of the active MJ and MN affiliates for each Org.
AND The Affiliates will be ordered in descending order based on level of play (MJ, then AAA, etc.) 
AND Each Affiliate block will contain the affiliate's current logo, the number of currently open action items the team has for stats violations, the number of preliminary transactions impacting the Affiliate
AND the number of pending transactions for the Affiliate (Submitted to Club or BOC). 
AND Mousing over the Active or Under Control number for each club will display the text "Active Limit: 25" and "Under Control Limit: 40"

title: BOC user can see the Roster Counts widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is on HOME page
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Roster Widget
custom_expected:
THEN The widget header will have a filter to choose which of the 30 Clubs rosters to display - defaulted for the BOC to the first alphabetically. 
AND The widget will match the provided wireframe, and will have enough blocks/rows to provide the current active and under control limits for each of the active MJ and MN affiliates for each Org. 
AND The Affiliates will be ordered in descending order based on level of play (MJ, then AAA, etc.) 
AND Each Affiliate block will contain the affiliate's current logo, the number of currently open action items the team has for stats violations, the number of preliminary transactions impacting the Affiliate, and the number of pending transactions for the Affiliate (Submitted to Club or BOC). 
AND Mousing over the Active or Under Control number for each club will display the text "Active Limit: 25" and "Under Control Limit: 40".  This should be implemented the same way it was for the Major and Minor League Roster widgets.

title: As a User, I want to be able to search for players with a specific clause from the Contract Language widget
custom_steps: Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contract_language_widget|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contract_language_widget]AC:* On the Contract Language widget, there will be a new 'Contracts' column added to the end of the widget* This column will display the number of contracts that contain the clause* The number of contracts will be a hyper link* Clicking the hyperlink will perform an advanced search and return the contracts that contain the clause** ContractID will need to be added as a filter on Advance Search* Users will be able to right-click and perform the search in a new tab/window* Club users should only see Contracts they have permission to see

title: INC0120420 - New widget / updated Contract Language widget
custom_steps: Received from: jeff.pfeifer@mlb.comRecipients: ebissupport@mlb.com,Garrett.Horan@mlb.com,gina.liento@mlb.com,rreuter@lbisoftware.com,matthew.salvatore@mlb.comWould like to expand this widget to include the following:-          To be able to return a list of players whose contract (Major or Minor) contained or contains the selected clause.  It was suggested that there be an option next to each clause (a new column) that, when selected, will take the user to the Advance Search with the specific contract clause type filled and the expected results listed.  The column could be labeled (‰ÛÏShow Players‰Û�)-          To add a row to each clause type that has a Club or Custom language version, and to be able to perform the same search described above on that selection as well-          To add Minor League Miscellaneous to the list of options in the Clause type

title: INC0145049 - add Salary and ML Base columns to MNC Adv Search export
custom_steps: AC:* When running an advanced search with a type of Minor Contract, Salary and ML Base will be result columns* When exporting these search results, Salary and ML Base will be included as columns in the exportFrom SNOW: I ran this advanced search below and when I export to excel or PDF it does not include the Salary and ML Base column in the export.  Those two columns do not export.

custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks run

THEN batch will find every player with current MN Roster Status of "Signed for Next Year" that have a contract for the current year and whose pending org and club’s season is in progress. (Club season dates)
AND for each player found, system will create and automatically approve the transaction "Activate Signed for Next Year". This transaction is not a form that is visible on the front end.

title: BOC can run Roster Management Batch
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is on batch screen
AND selects 'roster management'
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks run
custom_expected:
THEN batch will check each Major and Minor club’s under control and active limits against the actual counts and raise a notification if the club is over the limit. 
AND For each Club that violates its active limit, a notification is generated for the affected Club, and the BOC. 
AND The notification's description will be "[Club name in all caps] has violated the active limit. Limit: [limit] Actual: [Actual count]" 
AND For each Club that violates its under control limit, a notification is generated for the affected Club, and the BOC. 
AND The notification's description will be "[Club name in all caps] has violated the under control limit. Limit: [limit] Actual: [Actual count]" 
AND Results will be display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be - Org, Club, Exceeds Active Limit (Y/N), Exceeds Under Control Limit (Y/N) 
AND Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

title: BOC can run Potential MnFA Year Batch
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is on batch screen
AND selects "Potential MnFA Year Batch"
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks run
custom_expected:
THEN Running the batch will find all players with a current approved minor league contract.
AND System will determine how many remaining addendum C years each player has on their contract. This is the number of seasons that player has signed for subtract the number of years that have Addendum Cs
AND System will set each player's potential minor free agent year field in their profile to the last year. This is calculated as the current year plus remaining addendum C years. 
AND If the player has an active major contract with non option years plus excercised option years covering a year greater than the latest C year, the last year of the MJ contract will be used instead.
AND Results will display only the players that had their MN FA year updated in their profile. 
AND Results will display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be - Player ID, Player, Org, Club and New MnFA Year (Y/N)
AND Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

title: As a User I want to see a new Domestic Reserve column on the minor league roster widget
custom_steps: The minor league roster widget on the rosters page should have a new column to the right of the mn contract years column indicating whether or not the player counts against the domestic reserve count.AC* Minor League Roster has a new Domestic Reserve column* Players who are counting against the domestic reserve count will appear with a checkmark* Players who are NOT counting against the domestic reserve count will appear blank* Clicking on the column header will sort the widget by whether or not the players count against the limit

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Updates made to the 40-Man Players (Non-Club Player Pool) and Other Exempt Players Portion of the Club Player Pool Utility
custom_steps: Data Discovery:  https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/597196852/Data+Discovery+-+Club+Player+Pools+UtilityAC:The player population of the 40-Man Players (Non-Club Player Pool) and Other Exempt Players will be updated to the following: - MAJOR roster status is Designated for Assignment, Not Yet Reported, Disqualified, Ineligible, Military Leave, Restricted, Voluntarily Retired, Suspended, 60 Day ILOR - MAJOR roster status is Optioned AND player is on the alternate site AND MINOR roster status is one of: Disqualified, Ineligible, Military Leave, Restricted, Voluntarily Retired, 60 Day ILOR - Player is not on the MJ roster AND player is on the alternate site AND MINOR Roster status is one of: Disqualified, Ineligible, Military Leave, Restricted, Voluntarily Retired, 60 Day IL - Minor League 60-Day IL (assigned to Alt. Site)

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Updates made to the Alternate Training Site Portion of the Club Player Pool Utility
custom_steps: Data Discovery: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/597196852/Data+Discovery+-+Club+Player+Pools+UtilityAC:The player population logic of the Alternate Training Site widget will be updated to - MAJOR Roster status in: Bereavement List, Paternity List, Restricted/Assigned, 7 Day Concussion IL, 10 Day IL, Rehab 10 Day IL (assigned to Alt. Site), Rehab 60 Day IL (assigned to Alt. Site), Rehab 7 Day Concussion IL (assigned to Alt. Site), Minor League 7-Day IL (assigned to Alt. Site), Rehab 7 Day IL (assigned to Alt. Site), Rehab Minor League 60-Day IL (assigned to Alt. Site), Optioned (assigned to Alt. Site)OR - MAJOR Roster status is Optioned (without service) +AND+ Player‰Ûªs MINOR club is the alternate site AND MINOR roster status is NOT one of: Disqualified, Ineligible, Military Leave, Restricted, Voluntarily Retired, 60 Day ILåÊ - Minor League Roster Status is assigned to Alternate Training Site (Active Status will count towards the Alt Site Active List, all others do not)

custom_steps: DPL would prefer to get a full list of players that require consent rather than having to call for each year's list. title: As a User, I want the Rookie Threshold Calc updated
custom_steps: Currently, the rookie calculation is:_A player shall be considered a rookie unless, during a previous season or seasons, he had (a) exceeded 130 at-bats or 50 innings pitched in the Major Leagues; or (b) accumulated more than 45 days on the active roster of a Major League Club or Clubs during the period of the 26-player limit (excluding time on the Injured List)._* Given that we were without September call-ups this season, days of service on the Major League roster will +i++*nclude September 2020*+. Thus, any player who accumulated more than +*45 days on the active roster of a Major League Club or Clubs during the entire 2020 regular season or during previous seasons prior to September 1st will no longer be considered a rookie in 2021.*+* 2020 ROY Winners (Kyle Lewis and Devin WIlliams) will not be eligible to repeat as winners in 2021, should they otherwise qualify for consideration.The definition shall be updated as follows:* Any player who did not win 2020 ROY Award (Kyle Lewis and Devin WIlliams) will maintain their rookie status in 2021 if, during a previous season or seasons, they have (a) not exceeded 130 at-bats or 50 innings pitched in the Major Leagues; and (b) not accumulated more than 45 days on the active roster of a Major League Club or Clubs during the period of the 28-player limit (excluding time on the Injured List) used for most of the 2020 season or during previous seasons prior to September 1st

title: Tech Debt - Remove old Drupal search types from db
custom_preconds:
Remove the old ebis_as_drupal_searches table and any of the ebis_as_type rows associated with it. This table was previously used to distinguish angular search types from drupal search types, but since drupal search types are no longer used, we can delete them and fix the query that filters them out of the angular search types.

This is a priority for the ebis postgres migration, since we don't want to bring over old tables and want to keep the db2 data and pg data aligned so that we can validate the pg data against db2.

This will affect the endpoint we use to populate the “Search For” dropdown on the advanced search page and that will probably need regression testing from this change

custom_steps: In order to force an update to ldap we will add a button to the bottom of the user accounts page "Sync LDAP Report Permissions"This process will kick off the ldap sync and update a users ldap permissions based on whatever is currently stored for the user.Clicking the button will bring up a confirmation modal saying: "This process will sync up reporting permissions for this user that are currently stored in the ebis database with LDAP.  This is a permanent action and cannot be undone"  with the normal confirmation options.This button will be visible in VIEW mode (the screen cannot be in edit mode)The process for this should be synchronous (so it may take a while) and results for what was changed in LDAP should be displayed in the browsers console.AC:* Button exists and can be clicked in view mode* Confirmation modal is displayed* Results appear in the console
